document.title: 2023 Indiana Academic Standards: Grades 6-8 Physical Education

90DA90A0B7F0426A9673DBD52BA3D6F2.description:
Demonstrates the importance of social interaction by avoiding negative talk and
helping and encouraging others in various physical activities and games.

4A48194453FB4870BB750831144BF312.description:
Explains the relationship between self-expression and lifelong enjoyment
through physical activity.

BAF5F00CD7284FEE943BAE3D2ED24C06.description: Identifies why self-selected physical activities create enjoyment.

3A4496BFB6D04347AE9907ABC44DAA30.description:
Uses positive strategies when faced with a group challenge (such as offering
suggestions or assistance, leading or following others, and providing possible
solutions).

044A970BB94941AFA0AAC03A5F1DFC29.description:
Identifies different types of physical activities and describes how each has a
positive impact on health.

37C6D9214F5C47969F5C3E8B8D32D49F.description:
The physically literate individual recognizes the value of physical activity for
health, enjoyment, challenge, self expression, and/or social interaction.

8F6246940088418D815AE3EAD0E5917E.description:
Independently uses all equipment for physical activity and fitness appropriately
and safely.

6C4515EA46E1487DB11834377AC36C93.description:
Demonstrates cooperation by establishing rules and guidelines for resolving
conflicts.

6748D759E8094F7DA403A5793BB41BD6.description:
Provides corrective feedback to a peer using a teacher-generated rubric, while
using appropriate tone and other communication skills.

B9524EBD4146406EBF88BD54083892DA.description:
Demonstrates knowledge of rules and etiquette by self-officiating physical
activities and games or following parameters to create or modify a dance or rhythmic
activity.

372A2AE5779C401D94C828148FD25D36.description:
Exhibits responsible social behaviors by cooperating with classmates,
demonstrating inclusive behaviors, and supporting classmates.

D30EB507325049FD84019648C80A30FF.description:
The physically literate individual exhibits responsible personal and social behavior
that respects self and others.

29AF73442601462789374C137A11BFD2.description:
Maintains and reflects on a personal physical activity and hydration log to
document learning and set goals for improvement.

5FF08B52B84C49F086A2C4DD8103558B.description:
Uses a SMART (specific, measurable, attainable, realistic, and timely) goal to
improve or maintain two areas of health-related fitness based on a fitness assessment.

1346727A272E42468591A35DC5040B59.description:
Explains the relationship of caloric intake and expenditure to weight
management, and investigates strategies for balancing calories.

CAFBF3E7A46A46E5AAFEEB56494693DC.description:
Describes how muscles pull on bones to create movement in pairs by relaxing
and contracting.

9F8DD881867541D69075BF06D11A20A9.description:
Participates in a variety of cardiorespiratory endurance, muscular endurance,
and muscular strength activities.

C6839062044E4BB9BE47F1B635AF6C7D.description: Designs a warm-up or cool-down for a self-selected physical activity.

6867F68AC6824787B7D9C1D965B6072E.description:
Describes the FITT principle (frequency, intensity, time, type) for muscular
endurance, muscular strength, and flexibility.

277FDC90D37C45A0880D68B2D3F725E9.description:
Describes the relationship between cardiorespiratory activities and exercise
intensity (such as the Borg Rating of Perceived Exertion (RPE), the OMNI Scale, Heart
Rate Monitors, or taking a heart rate manually).

BB338F26C1EC418CA79E6E2477395EFB.description:
Describes and demonstrates the differences between dynamic and static
stretches.

10E138F201D94288850EA02731620D22.description: Differentiates between muscular strength and muscular endurance activities.

F05E0D9457F94DE9A13878C04E2CFEA5.description: Identifies the difference between health-related and skill-related fitness.

DC0D68BAB67B421C812FE0F9B7D9FD94.description: Participates in physical activity twice a week outside of physical education class.

D68E883A0CE84CF38F8B5EDFEB3DBD90.description:
Identifies barriers related to maintaining a physically active lifestyle and
identifies solutions for eliminating those barriers.

C29A6969AF014543BB37F9D27864301E.description:
The physically literate individual demonstrates the knowledge and skills to
achieve and maintain a health-enhancing level of physical activity and fitness.

9C2B1DD3B57F47DC827ED83DEA57B01E.description:
Demonstrates an offensive shot based on the opponent's location (hit where
the opponent is not).

3C0486474DEE41DB87A86EF94A40C02F.description: Tactics and Shots, Net and Wall Games

30F5976F1C4649818EDD9A4C266AEEFD.description:
Creates open space by varying force and direction, and forcing the opponent to
move from side to side.

BD2E69B03BD04B3CB37DFDF2ECCA1264.description: Creating Space, Net and Wall Games

1F353C40129647598916C1A789BC08EE.description:
Demonstrates the transitions from offense to defense and defense to offense
by recovering quickly and communicating with teammates.

52811318FAB945488BF7F111379D7459.description:
Selects the correct defensive play based on the situation. (field and strike
games)

06315549D7864779AD8005C4B8EEA8B5.description: Demonstrates a variety of shots to hit to open space. (field and strike games)

431A764AA85F41FC90FF825C07FB3A3F.description:
Demonstrates at least two ways to create open space (such as moving to open
space without a ball or object; using a variety of passes, pivots, and fakes; using the
give and go maneuver; using the width and length of the field/court; staying spread out
on offense; cutting and passing quickly). (invasion games)

13B2CD5430BD402D8D4D1EB0FB4B9FF4.description:
Analyzes the situation and makes appropriate decisions to ensure the safety of
self and/or others.

F5CC1ABDD551449284A1CCAF8FF6C717.description: Applies Newton's law of motion to various movement activities.

911F4CC6CDC7431DA5D629F5909E041E.description:
Determines how to change speed and/or trajectory of the shot based on
location of the object in relation to the target.

EA3E818F184C47AD810398CAAECCB892.description:
The physically literate individual applies knowledge of concepts, principles,
strategies, and tactics related to movement and performance.

96D9689263484C8CB939E32F482B0023.description:
Performs the defensive position and slides in all directions without crossing the
feet in a dynamic environment.

5FB0CDBD29C2474AB6C49C771EB5AA3C.description:
Performs at least one movement with the ball or object (such as dribbling)
against defensive pressure to create open space.

9F0F7E552691492087418BD7E9032338.description:
Performs at least one movement without the ball or object (such as the pivot,
give and go, fakes, or jab steps).

5735780DB23C489DA4EC9D275B4DF65F.description:
Performs controlled forehand and backhand volleys with competency with a
short- or long-handled implement in a dynamic environment.

378DFA888410443CB8CBEF43B4051CB7.description:
Performs an underhand or overhand serve to a target with competency, control,
and weight transfer.

DDE6DE50824F483281D210DA217098DA.description:
Performs shooting on goal with competency and accuracy in a dynamic
environment.

7608A9D80FCE4FC2BF076DE1F2DFE4AE.description:
Performs forehand and backhand strokes with competency while transferring
weight with correct timing, using a short- or long-handled implement in a dynamic
environment.

712CA902C31C4EB3B7F7FACFC74036AB.description:
Performs striking a moving object to open space, with competency, using an
implement in a variety of practices.

573893569CF247779F6AD893C85FF8A2.description:
Performs striking a stationary object for accuracy and distance, using an
implement, with competency in activities (such as golf, hockey).

21CB77B2F8AF4E6ABEDFB45009EDCF11.description: Performs striking with competency in a dynamic environment.

81D4CEA7A33A47D69536BB9BCD5E32E2.description:
Performs dribbling skills with dominant and nondominant hand, foot, and
implements with control while moving, changing directions, and speed in a variety of
practice tasks.

48C7AF2A53F34DD3BF31837A1EAFC56A.description: Demonstrates a lead pass with competency, while moving, to a moving receiver.

DC10DAC40E584F778C71038793143163.description:
Performs passing and receiving with hands, feet, or implements with competency
while moving, changing direction, and speed during small-sided game play.

7FFE7CF6822E44AAAE3D2C65296BB5B2.description:
Performs a mature catching pattern from a variety of trajectories using different
objects during small-sided game play.

C06DECA60FC34947BF43862E4792D38B.description:
Performs a mature throwing (underhand and overhand) pattern for accuracy in a
dynamic environment.

D6362A726695416BAFD772D0AA0C2A44.description:
Demonstrates correct rhythm and pattern for two of the following activities:
dance, including folk, social, creative, line, and world; jump bands; and cardio drumming).

947FCB0B87EC42F6BB4E9EBDC7C122BE.description: Performs correct technique for a variety of skills in one selected outdoor activity.

5F649D22207F4E9B9A1DBA791A0DABD7.description:
Performs correct technique for a variety of skills in one selected individual
performance activity.

46309A6E5D7948F88D226035A162B520.description:
The physically literate individual will demonstrate competency in a variety of
motor skills and movement patterns.
